properties.entry: Only occurs when a node is near
Only occurs within influence of a %s node
Common in many parts of the world, these bees have a little extra whimsy about them.|Apinomicon
Fond of warm, dry environments, they seem to have the ability to conjure water from thin air.|Apinomicon
"A curious specimen for my collection!"|Junior Apiarist
They fly as though guided by unseen threads through the air.|Apinomicon
The potential that was locked within this bee's ancestors has now come to the fore.|Apinomicon
An unusual crossbreed which seems to have magical properties.|Apinomicon
These bees have been to the end of the world and back, and their power has grown.|Apinomicon
"Their produce is charged with magic."|Azanor, Master Thaumaturge
Your first experiments in Thaumaturgical Apiculture have yielded fruit. Buzzing fruit.|Apinomicon
Successive generations of Charmed bees have reinforced their connection to the unknown.|Apinomicon
These bees walk the line between this world and the unseen.|Apinomicon
Ghostly, and charged with energy from beyond.|Apinomicon
Fond of damp spots and flowing water.|Apinomicon
They have an iron-strong connection with stone and dirt.|Apinomicon
As close as you can get to living flame without involving candescence.|Apinomicon
Rarely seen in flat, wide open spaces. Their territories are vast.|Apinomicon
"What does that bee want with my paper?!"|Yorae, Librarian
"I can't be sure, but I think they might be smarter than me..."|Yorae, Librarian
lim(x^(i / pi)/ log(e * 7 - ln(32/x^-pi))). Solve for honey.|Note found on Yorae's desk
"They can see into your soul!"|Florastar, Expert Beekeeper
It is said these bees are able to contact the dead.|Apinomicon
"The Dread Pirate Roberts has come for your SOOOOOOULS!"|Dread Pirate Roberts
These bees have become xenophobic and bad-tempered. Use caution.|Apinomicon
Spiderbee; n. Does whatever a spider-bee does.|Unknown
The Skulking bees have become alight with the fire of the ever-burning Blazes.|Apinomicon
"An apiarist is never late. He arrives precisely when he means to!"|Sengir, Mad Apiarist
They live in peace, within the sight of the Eye of Harmony|Tattered Remains of ancient Apinomicon
"Would you like a Jelly Baby?"|Passing stranger with a great scarf and a blue box
Spawned deep within the hellish realm, none have survived long enough to determine their abilities.|Apinomicon
Continued exposure to the Nether has not improved their temperament in the least. Use caution.|Apinomicon
They guard their territory fiercely, with the zeal of fiends, and welts of fire.|Apinomicon
Their mere passing causes life to fail, slowly drawing all energy from their territory.|Apinomicon
It is unclear whether these bees are native to this world, or some other.|Apinomicon
"Other naturalists have refused to study these bees. I must know why."|Tattered Research Notes
"The more I study these bees, the more I feel they do not belong here, or anywhere else."|Tattered Research Notes
"I am now convinced they were left in our universe on purpose by some unknowable beings."|Tattered Research Notes
"With a fel sound, they erupted from their hive. That was the last we ever saw of Gerald."|Tattered Research Notes
Having absorbed some of the base metal, these bees can concentrate the essence of iron from the region.|Apinomicon
Not all that glitters is gold.|Ancient Aphorism
A base metal common in many applications; these bees are helpful for resource-starved magicians.|Apinomicon
While metalic, these bees are suprisingly fragile.|Apinomicon
While they do not recieve as much attention as Golden bees, they are nonetheless valuable.|Apinomicon
A favourite of amateur alchemists, they believe they can transform these bees into gold.|Apinomicon
Fond of yellowish-orange material found in hellish areas.|Apinomicon
The unstable properties of this material seem to not affect the bees in the slightest.|Apinomicon
Crystalline, glittering, and harder than dragon's teeth. These bees are none of those.|Apinomicon
It is said they have been to a land ruled by a Great Wizard, and have taken the aspect of his city.|Apinomicon

Day and night the whining droned on. I barricaded the windows and hid in the cellar, but everywhere the high-pitched noise of the apatine bees penetrated the walls and drove me to distraction.|Beekeeping 101
Changeable in nature, mercurial in personality.|Apinomicon
"I could've sworn this was made out of stone yesterday!"|Sengir, Mad Apiarist
They have a corrosive effect on their surroundings, rapidly aging them.|Apinomicon
Easy to miss, their glassy body is difficult to spot in the countryside.|Apinomicon
"They work so fast it's breathtaking."|Sengir, Mad Apiarist
Caution: Contents of hive extremely hot.|Warning label on Azanor's apiary
"I tried to breed them once, but that was a wash."|MysteriousAges, Apprentice Thaumaturge
"You're really gonna dig these bees, but watch out - they bore quite easily."|MysteriousAges, Apprentice Comedian
Their combs are nearly perfect, each part mirroring the pattern of the whole.|Apinomicon
The social structure of their hives seems to vary day by day, making it more flexible and resillient than others, but significantly more unpredictable.|Apinomicon
"They can feel changes in the aura, but are not yet able to affect it."|Azanor, research notes
"I thought they would help clean up, but it only makes things worse!"|Kreicus, Apprentice Thaumaturge
Having undergone a freak mutation, these bees now attract magic to them.|Apinomicon
The hum of the hive is magical, and over time is absorbed by nearby nodes.|Apinomicon
Their combs may be fetid and foul-smelling, but their intelligence is well-developed.|Apinomicon
Their language is garbled and unintelligible. It is probable they are speaking to unnatural beings.|Apinomicon
They tend to attract bats to their hives through means unknown.|Apinomicon
"Cluck. Cluck cluck! ... You heard me."|Confused bee
It may be possible to exploit their mercurial and changeable nature.|Apinomicon
Drawing from motes of dust in the air and ground, they concentrate the energy
The heart of magic lies dormant in all things.|Apinomicon, preface
Empowered by the Earth, their produce is infused with its essence.|Apinomicon
Swift as the wind, and lighter than air.|Apinomicon
Their colony can reach temperatures that boil water and melt metals.|Apinomicon
Through prolonged exposure to liquids, their combs are quite wet and heavy.|Apinomicon
They can travel vast distances in a blink, and are known for starting many wildfires.|Apinomicon
They have an affinity for all that is green and grows.|Apinomicon
"They keep stealing stuff from me, and I never see them. They're far too slippery."|MysteriousAges, incorrigible punster
As they fly by, they sear the surface of the landscape, eventually scouring all plants and fragile minerals away.|Apinomicon
"Curious creatures, though their produce is quite useful."|Mithion, Adept
Ravenous for mana, they may be dangerous for any caster.|Apinomicon
"They attract magical spirits; not always docile."|Mithion, Adept
The curious species found scattered through the world may have abilities beyond one's reasoning.|Apinomicon
These bees have inexplicable affinity for magic.|Apinomicon
No longer ordinary bees, they have been associated with many odd occurances.|Apinomicon
The caste of bees which have great intellect and deductive ability.|Apinomicon
Unpleasant and malicious. Treat this group with caution.|Apinomicon
It is unclear whether they are sentient, but they have suprising awareness of their surroundings.|Apinomicon
Though clever use of time travel, these bees accomplish twice as much in one day.|Apinomicon
It would be eerie to think that they collected the souls of the deceased.|Apinomicon
Spawned in the firey depths of the Nether, there is nothing pleasant about these creatures.|Apinomicon
It is unknown whether these creatures gave rise to the family Apidae in this universe, or if these evolved seperately.|Apinomicon
They collect fragments of metal and combine them into larger portions.|Apinomicon
They collect fragments of precious gems in their combs.|Apinomicon
Reality seems to be somewhat volatile around bees of this family.|Apinomicon
These bees have an increased affinity to magic and aura.|Apinomicon
Through an unknown mechanism, these bees accrue chunks of animal flesh. Somehow, it's still edible.|Apinomicon
These bees have a changeable nature.|Apinomicon
These bees have an increased affinity for aspected magic.|Apinomicon
[MB] Adding some sparkle to your buzz.

Welcome to Apimancy! As a budding keeper of magical bees, there are a few things you should know before diving in. As your acceptance letter to the Academy of Austere Apimancers has mentioned, there are several new tools available to discover. These include some improved versions of Forestry tools, each with their own particular quirks and new frames for your apiaries. ##horizontalRule## You may also discover that there are new bee strains available to discover, if you can coax them to live in certain conditions. The Forestry Escritoire will help you discover them and become the envy

of your former, nonmagical colleagues. Also take note of the several new strains of wild bees that have appeared: these are the key to progressing into the magical lineages of your small winged charges.

While experimenting with bee breeds, you may run accross a strain whose intellectual capabilities are a match for your own. Well, maybe, however unlikely that is. It's possible that they may unearth some obscure reference or a snippet of information that your great intellect may have missed while exploiting the greater mysteries of the universe. ##lineBreak## Should your helpful buzzing friends happen to locate this sort of item for you, it may be possible to combine the scraps together into something a little more cohesive.

The Magic Frame is a simple improvement over your regular, run-of-the-mill Untreated Frames. Still fairly simple to produce, it is capable of lasting three times longer in an apiary than Untreated Frames before becoming unuseable. The enchantable properties of the Magic Frame enable it to be used with several of the special essences involved in Apimancy where other frames would reject the infusion of magics.

Normal scoops are fragile, and prone to breakage. As an authority in Apimancy, you can do better. By adding some Thaumium to the handle, and lacing it with a measure of order, your new scoop will last up to three times longer! ##lineBreak## In addition, the Thaumium in the device will accept the Repair enchantment.

Simple grafters are almost uselessly fragile, and while Proven Grafters are useful, the rarity of emeralds makes them annoying to procure. The solution? Make it yourself! ##lineBreak## The Thaumium Grafter, like the Thaumium Scoop, is a tougher, enchantable version of the most basic of the Arborimancer's tools. Use caution though, for although the Repair enchantment can be applied to the grafter, its unusual properties make it exhausting to use.
[MB] A rose by any other name. . .

Simple to create by means of magic, this essence has unusual properties when exposed to bees. When combined with an everyday apiary frame, it has the effect of greatly extending the lifespan of a working hive.

The Essence of a Shallow Grave channels the death of many of the ... "natural" creatures that wander the world: Zombies, Skeletons, those sorts of things. Exposing bees to this energy has the effect of making them slow and sluggish, and curtails the extent of their lifespan. Some Apimancers consider using frames imbued with these Essences to be cruel, however, others view it as a natrual part of normal beekeeping, with an eye to creating their perfect strain of bees sometime within THEIR lifetime. ##lineBreak## The Apimancer's Guild of Safety recommends handling them with telekenisis or very long tongs.

This is the distilled essence of protection, bound to last forever, or until the magics stored within it weaken and eventually break. But until then, it's invincible. Mostly. ##lineBreak## While Magic Frames are useful, they are a tad fragile. This essence takes the enchantments you weave into Magic frames to an entirely new level. Combine the essence with a magic frame, and it should have a vastly extended lifespan.

Unstable by nature, the Essence of Fickle Permanence has the side effect of causing normally stable objects and systems to become somewhat unreliable. While this may mostly be a bad thing, Apimancers have discovered that exposing a hive to the essence has the duel effects of both causing the bees to work faster, and the offspring to have higher mutation rates.

Time is a fickle thing. It comes and it goes, but where exactly does it go to? As a respectable thaumaturge, it has become possible to trap these wasted moments and save them in a magical form. So, now that it is possible to collect extra time from the world, it seems only appropriate that they are used in a place that would be useful. It would be too dangerous to attempt to access these moments yourself for the moment, but perhaps it would be simple to allow your bees access to this untapped lump of time. ##lineBreak## By combining the essence with a Magic Frame as usual will suffice to extend the lifespan of bees in your keeping by several times.
[MB] Quantum flux for them, unlimited storage for you

While it may appear similar to the Portable Hole, it serves as a two-way link with another place, which is... probably uninhabited. It should be possible to utilize these singularities to store materials outside of your dimensional understanding - which of course means that they won't clutter up your inventory. As they are now, they are not particularly useful, but there should be ways to unlock their potential.

Breeding bees for mutations can be aggrivating, especially whith long-lived species. With a little cleverness and only the slightest hint of smugness, you have found a way to utilize the Dimensional Singularity in a manner that only sucks away the life force of your tiny flying friends, bit by bit. Well, maybe significant amounts all at once. It's probably not going to affect them too badly. ##lineBreak## It may be somewhat tricky to obtain more than one of the §5Dragon Eggs§0 nessecary to obtain more than one of these. Perhaps there is a bee species that can assist with the limitation.
